intro: Pilosella leptophyton subsp. leptophyton, commonly known as the slenderleaf hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has slender, hairy stems and small, yellowish flowers arranged in a flat, disk-like structure. Its subspecies is distinguished by its relatively narrow leaves and specific geographic distribution.
